info.title: Common Room Community API
info.description:
Common Room Community REST APIs for accessing Community scoped resources.

To use the Common Room API, or get started with the Common Room Zapier integration, you will need to create an API token. To create an API token:
  1. Navigate to Setting | API tokens
  2. Click on “Request Access to API”. Our API is currently in beta, so you need to first apply for access.
  3. Once access is granted, return to the Settings | API tokens screen, and you will see a button to create a “New Token”.
# Authentication

BearerAuth.description:
Use a Community API JWT as a Bearer token in the Authentication header.

Tokens can be created by Community Owners through https://app.commonroom.io/

Example:

```
curl -H "Authorization: Bearer abcd123.xzy" \
  https://api.commonroom.io/community/v1
````

User.description:
Represents the user account in the Common Room community
This account is used for identity mangement via SCIM
Specification can be found at https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7643#section-4.1

active.description: Indicates whether the user has a login account in the community

servers.description: Common Room Community API Production Server

socialType.description: Must be email, twitter, github, or linkedin

post.summary: Adds a new or existing tag to a Community Member

socialType.description: Must be email, twitter, github, or linkedin

/user/{email}.description:
Represents a Community Member associated with an email address within the community
identified by the authentication scheme.

get.description: A Community Member's profile based on an email address.

delete.description:
Request removal of all personally identifiable information (PII) for the
Community Member associated by this email address.

This does not immediately anonymize the community member. The anonymization
is queued and will happen at a future time within 15 days.

get.summary: Get Community Member By E-Mail or Socials

first_seen.description: Date when member appeared in your community in ISO 8601 format

last_active.description: Date of the member's last activity in ISO 8601 format

type.description: enum, string, date, int, url, boolean

/Users.description: Represents users with a valid login. Community owners are returned

get.description: Returns the list of active owners, filtered based on the query parameters

totalResults.description: Number of resources in the list

itemsPerPage.description: Constant number of items per page

post.summary: Creates the community member with specific role
post.description: Creates the community member with owner role

active.description: Indicates whether the user has a login account in the community

/Users/:email.description: Retrieves or updates the specific user

schema.example: User accounts' identifier. Typically the email address

patch.description: Updates the user account specified in the query

active.description:
Will upgrade or downgrade user account's role based on this property. When set to false
user account is downgraded

post.description: Add an activity to existing community member(s) with matching socials
post.summary: Add an activity to existing community member(s)

socialType.description: Must be email, twitter, github, or linkedin

activityType.description: ActivityType. Use the GetActivityType API to get a list of types

occurredAt.description: Date when the activity occurred in ISO 8601 format

tags.description: Comma separated string of tags to apply to the activity
